main.name: Daus
main.description: I want to change the world through art and technology from my own comfortable home
main.bio: I love to play with front end frameworks, data analytics, data mining, graphic design, game engines and Java. Currently am interested in exploring backend and game design.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

skillmessage.description: I have experience in graphic design, front-end and game design in the past. Currently been working on back-end.
skillmessage.note: Measurements are based on proficiency/frequency of interaction, rather than any "universal" measurement.

education.degree: Bachelors of Science in Computer Science
education.minor: Graphic Design and Game Design minor
education.description: Three of my greatest achievements in school was to be able to create a VR game and be exhibited at a gallery, be the top 10% for my favorite class, Algorithms and be able to establish and found a group of CS students passionate in helping non-profits for social change.

details.bullet1: Managed full data stack including front-end development, logging, SQL database, feature engineering and model construction for educational Javascript games that have 20,000+ plays/month
details.bullet2: Developed functionalities in educational video games to enhance user experience

details.bullet1: Created low dimensionality front-end plots of high dimensionality database entries for scientists to view online, using MongDB, Python, Scikit-learn, UMAP, and Bokeh, automated with Bash.
details.bullet2: Built an automated application to combine, process, and publish various data sources into web-ready JSON objects using fasta, various APIs, SQLite, Python, Numpy, Pandas, Perl, and Bash.

details.bullet1: Developed a responsive website to host the blue whale genomic data for research publication using React, CSS, Typescript and Bootstrap.
details.bullet2: Deployed a Javascript-based application on KVM to process and view large data for scientists using Python and Bash.

projects.title: Dausie Blog
projects.category: My blog for coding and fun things

projects.title: Jisho Dictionary
projects.category: (in-progress) A Google Chrome extension to log Japanese words and their translations

projects.title: RecycleIt
projects.category: (in-progress) React-based web app to categorize recyclables using camera and trashNET.

projects.title: Teratai
projects.category: (in-progress) Angular-based web app to check ingredients in beauty products via Google Text API

projects.title: Find the Angel
projects.category: (Oculus Only) A horror VR immersive game made for a graphic design class built using Oculus Rift

projects.title: Process Sym
projects.category: A Python-based pipeline to process genes into identifiable descriptive JSON objects using the NCBI databases.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
